snippet: For Dasani, one of New York City’s 22,000 homeless children, school is everything — a provider of meals, nursing care and substitute parenting.
abstract: Dasani is one of more than 22,000 homeless children in New York City, and her public school in Fort Greene, Brooklyn, Susan S McKinney Secondary School of the Arts, is part of the perilous bedrock of her future; squalid city-run homeless shelter where 11-year-old lives, Auburn Family Residence, has been been cited for more than 400 violations over last decade (Series: Invisible Child).

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rebecca R. Ruiz and Joseph Goldstein, and research by Ms. Ruiz, Joseph Burgess, Alain Delaquérière and Ramsey Merritt.

lead_paragraph: For Dasani, one of New York City’s 22,000 homeless children, school is everything — a provider of meals, nursing care and substitute parenting.

headline.main: Dasani: A Future Resting on a Fragile Foundation
headline.print_headline: A Future Resting on a Fragile Foundation
